author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Free October adult art workshops
text:
Free October adult art workshops Sep 28, 2015 Elements of autumn are featured in Catinka Knoth’s adult art series at Rockland Public Library in October. 
Rockland — Catinka Knoth will offer instruction in drawing autumn scenes, on drawing in color, Mondays at 11 a.m. in the Community Room of Rockland Public Library, 80 Union St. Materials are supplied during the free adult workshops that will meet weekly Oct. 5, 19 and 26 (the library is closed on Columbus Day). 
Led by Knoth, participants will create their own colored drawings of October-themed scenes. Each class offers a different subject; Oct. 5, apples and apple trees; Oct. 19, autumn leaves and scenes; and Oct. 26, Halloween pumpkins. Knoth provides the classes free of charge and open to the general public, and the Friends of Rockland Library host. 
Knoth paints watercolors of Maine and whimsical animal scenes, which she offers as cards and prints. She also teaches a free weekly children's drawing class at Rockland Public Library, sponsored by Wendy and Keith Wellin. For more information about her work, visit catinkacards.com. For more information about the free workshops, call Knoth at 596-0069 or the library at 594-0310. 
Courier Publications’ A&E Editor Dagney C. Ernest can be reached at (207) 594-4401, ext. 115; or dernest@courierpublicationsllc.com.
